poem:
"From the Record's Grooves"

Between the minutes and seconds of sound,
Lies the weight of pure melodic art,
Carve it not in silence, but in part,
A sprawling testament to voices abound.

Layers upon layers of notes wrestled,
In a sonnet of strings and beats,
An ode, full and replete,
Within a cowboy's journey, nestled.

Even in length, it sings untethered,
An album, grand in credits and worth,
Each minute— a birth,
Of Beyonce's country, subtly feathered.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guide #133: Why is Beyoncé’s Cowboy Carter so long? Have you listened to Cowboy Carter yet? No, but I mean all of it? All 27 tracks? All 78 minutes and 21 seconds? Don’t be ashamed if you haven’t. Beyoncé’s sprawling paean to country music is a formidable piece of work, created by a boatload’s worth of talent (seriously, check out how long those album credits are), full of luscious layered textures and inventive production,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Guide #133: Why is Beyoncé’s Cowboy Carter so long? Have you listened to Cowboy Carter yet? No, but I mean all of it? All 27 tracks? All 78 minutes and 21 seconds? Don’t be ashamed if you haven’t. Beyoncé’s sprawling paean to country music is a formidable piece of work, created by a boatload’s worth of talent (seriously, check out how long those album credits are), full of luscious layered textures and inventive production,
